titleproper.value:
Guide to the Carpenters For a Stronger Union (CSU) Records
                    <num>WAG.066</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jane Latour

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T20:58-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Carpenters for a Stronger Union Records

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: In 1981, a small group of individuals acted in concert to organize and agitate within the District Council of Carpenters in New York City and some of its twenty-two locals in an effort to dislodge their corrupt leaders. Calling themselves Carpenters for a Stronger Union (CSU), they publicly challenged their elected officials. The records of the Carpenters for a Stronger Union include election materials, newsletters, flyers, NLRB decisions, correspondence, typescripts and newspaper clippings.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Attie, Jeanie, and Steinberg, Allen. 
                        <title render="italic">Carpenters - New York State: A History of the New York State Council of the Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, 1881-1981</title>. Buffalo: New York State Council of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners, 1982.</item>
                    <item>Brooks, Thomas. 
                        <title render="italic">Road to Dignity: A Century of Conflict: A History of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners, AFL-CIO, 1881-1981</title>. New York: Atheneum, 1981.</item>
                    <item>Christie, Robert A. 
                        <title render="italic">Empire in Wood: A History of the Carpenter's Union</title>. Ithaca New York: Cornell University Press.</item>
                    <item>Corruption and Racketeering in the New York City Construction Industry. 
                        <title render="italic">Interim Report by the New York State Organized Crime Task Force</title>. Ithaca NY: ILR Press, Cornell University, 1988.</item>
                    <item>Galenson, Walter. 
                        <title render="italic">The United Brotherhood of Carpenters: the First Hundred Years</title>. Cambridge: Harvard University Press, 1983.</item>
                    <item>Horowitz, Morris A. 
                        <title render="italic">The Structure and Government of the Carpenters' Union</title>. New York: Wiley, 1962.</item>
                    <item>Hutchinson, John. 
                        <title render="italic">The Imperfect Union: A History of Corruption in American Trade Unions</title>. New York: E.P. Dutton, 1970.</item>
                    <item>Lyon, David Nicholas. 
                        <title render="italic">The World of P.J. McGuire: A Study of the American Labor Movement, 1870-1890</title>.</item>
                    <item>Raddock, Maxwell C. 
                        <title render="italic">Portrait of an American Labor Leader: William L. Hutcheson: Saga of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, 1881-1954</title>. New York: American Institute of Social Science, 1955.</item>
                    <item>Schneirov, Richard, and Suhrbur, Thomas J. 
                        <title render="italic">Union Brotherhood: Union Town: The History of the Carpenters, 1863-1987</title>. Chicago: University of Chicago, 1988.</item>
                    <item>Seidman, Harold. 
                        <title render="italic">Labor Czars: A History of Labor Racketeering</title>. New York: Liveright, 1938.</item>
                </list>
Prominent names appearing in the records are Ted Maritas, Paschal McGuinness, John O'Connor, Martin Forde, Benny Schepis; Arthur Giangrande; Sammy "the Bull" Gravano.

subject.value: Carpenters |x Labor unions |z New York (State) |z New York.
Labor union democracy |z New York (State) |z New York.
Labor unions |x Corrupt practices |z New York (State) |z New York.
